page.title: 08ECOLOGY 2
page.content: It was a glorious sight leaving the town and walking through the fields of barley where poppies grew at the edge. We saw sparrows, swifts and starlings flying low looking for lunch. Some cows were grazing in one field and a pony came up to the fence to greet us. There were two alsatian dogs guarding the yard of Giddygate farm. Moss and wallflowers were growing over the old walls. In the canal we saw ducks, some dead roach and one dead barn owl. We have our own pond and sanctuary arena at school and a tree nursery for young oak and chestnut trees that we have grown from seeds. In the pond are newts, frogs, a toad, some roach, tench and crucian carp. There are yellow iris, reeds, water lilies, pondweed, duckweed, snails and waterboatmen. Many garden birds come to feed from the bird table
